page.title: 10Morwenstow - Games
page.content: Children enjoy a variety of both trad- itional and modern games at playtime in school. Many boys and some girls prefer{football. }Other games include: {Train Catch: }one child is catcher and counts to 20 then gives chase. Anyone caught joins on to form a 'train' and the last caught is catcher next time. {Stick in the Mud: }a catch game where anyone caught stands still with legs apart but is freed if another player goes through them. The catcher tries to make all others 'stick in the mud'. {Skipping is}popular; one rhyme goes :- {"Bumper-car, bumper-car, No.27, Racing {round the corner with a crash, bang, {wallop, Please put on your brakes." {Hopscotch }needs a grid chalked on the playground. Players hop from one end to the other and back, pushing or throwing a small pebble as they go. {From observations at St Mark's School
